page.title: 02Farming Around Lound
page.content: This has been a farming area since, at least, Domesday times. Today farms are quite small between 100-450 acres. They are mixed farms but mainly arable. The stock kept are beef and dairy cattle but dairying is decreasing. The main crops grown are barley,beet and peas. Although some farmers own their land others are tenants of Lord Somerleyton and Waveney District Council. The 1851 Census Returns show that half the Lound population worked on farms as farmers, labourers,dairy maids and shepherds. Now less than 30 people work on farms. Farms are run by families with little help except at harvest time. The pea harvest requires no extra labour as the buyer,Bird's Eye,Lowestoft,supplies the viner and transport. Fewer workers are needed because farms today are highly mechanised and modernised with E.E.C. grants.
